properties.Name: InsuranceProductPremiumTable
properties.Description:
A table used to calculate the premium for the associated Annuity or Insurance policy.

Three primary factors are considered when computing the basic premium:

(1)  Mortality

A mortality table indicates the expectation of life at given ages and the probability of death.

(2)  Interest

An insurer assumes that a specific net rate of interest will be earned on all its investments and that one full year's interest will be earned by each premium policyholders pay.

(3)  Expense

The expense factors of the insurer are computed and included in premium rates.
These are sometimes called 'Loading Charges'.

Additional factors considered include:

- Sex
- Interest Factor
- Expense Factor
- Health
- Lifestyle
- Occupation
- Age

Columns.Name: ProductId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Product.

Columns.Name: SubstandardRiskAssessmentMethodId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Substandard Risk Assessment Method.

Columns.Name: RiskClassificationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Risk Classification.

Columns.Name: PeriodStartDate
Columns.Description: The period start date for which the premium table is calculated.

Columns.Name: PeriodEndDate
Columns.Description: The period end date for which the premium table is calculated.

Columns.Name: PolicyTerm
Columns.Description: The term of the insurance policy.

Columns.Name: BasicPremiumAmount
Columns.Description: The basic amount that is charged for the associated insurance prior to additional factors and loads being taken into account.

Columns.Name: TotalPremiumAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of premium for the computed factors and risks associated with the insurance policy.

Columns.Name: PremiumAnnualCostPer1000Coverage
Columns.Description:
The computed per $1,000 face amount for the associated insurance.

Premium rates for life insurance are generally expressed as an annual cost per $1,000 face amount.

Columns.Name: PolicyPremiumFactorsPercentage
Columns.Description: The total percentage above the Basic Premium Amount that is added for the corresponding Policy Premium Factors.

Columns.Name: PolicyPremiumFactorsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount above the Basic Premium Amount that is added for the corresponding Policy Premium Factors.

Columns.Name: SubstandardRiskAssessmentPremiumIncreasePercentage
Columns.Description: The percentage of increase over the Basic Premium Amount to accommodate the associated Substandard Risk Assessment(s).

Columns.Name: SubstandardRiskAssessmentPremiumIncreaseAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of increase over the Basic Premium Amount to accommodate the associated Substandard Risk Assessment(s).

Columns.Name: NetSinglePremiumAmount
Columns.Description: Net Single Premium = Mortality Cost - Interest

Columns.Name: GrossPremiumAmount
Columns.Description: Gross Premium = Net Single Premium + Expense

Properties.Description:
A table used to calculate the premium for the associated Annuity or Insurance policy.

Three primary factors are considered when computing the basic premium:

(1)  Mortality

A mortality table indicates the expectation of life at given ages and the probability of death.

(2)  Interest

An insurer assumes that a specific net rate of interest will be earned on all its investments and that one full year's interest will be earned by each premium policyholders pay.

(3)  Expense

The expense factors of the insurer are computed and included in premium rates.
These are sometimes called 'Loading Charges'.

Additional factors considered include:

- Sex
- Interest Factor
- Expense Factor
- Health
- Lifestyle
- Occupation
- Age
